catalog_info.title: Renaissance Epic: War, Identity, Desire
catalog_info.description: We analyze the driving forces behind epic in the classic and medieval world_war, identity, and desire_and their transformation at the dawn of modernity. In order to prepare for the close reading of Torquato Tasso's Jerusalem Delivered, we will study and discuss selected cantos from the Iliad, the Odyssey, the Aeneid, the Chanson de Roland, Dante's Divine Comedy, Boiardo's Orlando innamorato and Ariosto's Orlando Furioso.
